===Etymology===
Probably originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほおずき|頬|tr1=hō|t1=cheeks|付き|tr2=tsuki|t2=resembling, appearing like|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|付く}} ''tsuku'' “to stick → to become a certain state or quality”}}, from the way the [[husk]] vaguely resembles [[bulge|bulging]] red cheeks. {{rendaku2|sort=ほおずき|tsuki|zuki}}

The {{lang|ja|鬼灯}} kanji spelling is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]], literally meaning “demon's lantern”. The {{ja-l|酸漿}} kanji spelling is from the Chinese term.
